newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK money rates steady to lower, paper yields mixed.
newsitem.headline: HK money rates steady to lower, paper yields mixed.

text.p: Interbank rates were steady to easier on Wednesday and governme t paper yields were mixed in very thin trading, dealers said.
Overnight cash eased to 4-1/2 3/8 percent from 4-3/4 5/8 at Tuesday midday and three-month money was virtually unchanged at 5-5/8 1/2 percent.
"There is light demand on two-week and one-month money. Otherwise, trading was featureless," a dealer said.
The interbank market was unmoved by news that the United States decided to keep interest rates unchanged but brokers said upward pressure on rates should continue in early 1997.

Government paper was mixed with short-term bill yields easing on the back of a liquid cash market but long-term note yields taking the lead of U.S. treasury yields, which edged up overnight, dealers said.
One-week bill yielded 4.18 percent, down from 4.21 and one-month yields eased three basis points to 4.32 percent.
Three-year note yields rose to 6.15 percent from 6.13, seven-year yields edged up to 7.15 from 7.11 percent and the longest 10-year note yielded 7.39 versus 7.35 percent.
